body_html:
Why are you creating tf.Graph and tf.Sessions in a tf.data map function? Your error is occuring on the line print("sess.run(data_list): ", sess.run(data_list), "\n"), because the tensor that is the argument to the map function is defined in the (original) default graph, which is different from the graph in the session. But more generally, creating sessions and graphs in tf.data function is not a common or supported pattern. What is the objective of your program?

(Side note: If you removed the commented out code lines in your code before sharing the snippet, it would be more human readable :) )

body:
Why are you creating tf.Graph and tf.Sessions in a tf.data map function? Your error is occuring on the line `print("sess.run(data_list): ", sess.run(data_list), "\n")`, because the tensor that is the argument to the map function is defined in the (original) default graph, which is different from the graph in the session. But more generally, creating sessions and graphs in tf.data function is not a common or supported pattern. What is the objective of your program? 

(Side note: If you removed the commented out code lines in your code before sharing the snippet, it would be more human readable :) )
